popup.text: Mastering this means being able to script real-world tools, parse system artifacts, and automate tasks safely and clearly.

exercises.label: Functions and error handling
Reading CLI arguments with `argparse`
Write your own `grep` clone in Python
Read, write, and clean log files
Extract fields from messy strings using `re`
Summarize logs using `collections.Counter`
Parse timestamps and sort events chronologically
🔖 Project: Security Log Analyzer
Script a CLI Recon Routine
Clone `uptime`, `top`, and `who` in One Script
Chain Python and Bash for Custom CLI Commands
✨ Bonus: Trigger a Live Alert on Suspicious Behavior
Simulate TCP Handshake Visually
Deep DNS Resolution
Map Traceroute as Graph
Port Scanning Modes (Nmap + Theory)
Decode ARP & MAC Behavior
Identify Protocols and Layers
Build a Ping Flood Simulation (Safe)
Identify Firewall Blocking Behavior
Use Wireshark to capture basic HTTP traffic
Identify protocols like DNS, ICMP, TCP in `.pcap`
Follow TCP streams and extract credentials (if visible)
Create basic `.pcap` filter cheatsheet
Create your own `tcpdump` wrapper in Python
Scan Targets and Identify Services with `python-nmap`
Build a Passive Subdomain Enumerator
Scrape and Parse Open Directories
Build a DNS Brute-forcer in Python
🔖 Project: Python Recon Toolkit

popup.text: Mastery means knowing how to find, exploit, and **fix** flaws in web apps—manually and methodically.

exercises.label: Write a Script to Mimic a Browser (but Not Quite)
Build a CLI Login Tool Using `requests`
Poison the Headers
Intercept and Replay Login Requests with Burp Suite
🕹️ Lab: PortSwigger – HTTP Request Smuggling & Parsing
Reflected XSS in a Search Parameter
Stored XSS in a Comment System
Bypass a Login Using SQL Injection
Build Regex to Validate Safe Usernames
🕹️ CTF: OWASP XSS & SQLi Practice
Use Flask's `request.args` safely
Add Content Security Policy headers
Block dangerous input with whitelist filtering
🔖 Project: Break & Fix Flask App
Deploy a secure Flask app on AWS Lightsail

popup.text: Mastery means being able to detect suspicious changes, unusual processes, and hidden indicators of compromise.

exercises.label: Monitor file access with `inotifywait`
Write a file change logger in Python
Compare file hashes to detect tampering
Schedule integrity checks with cron
Bonus: Track USB insertion events on Linux (`udevadm` + logging)
Detect strange processes (`nc`, `python`, `curl`)
Correlate processes with usernames
Alert on rare processes (via frequency thresholding)
Build a script that logs processes > X CPU usage
🕹️ Room: TryHackMe – Linux Monitoring
Something Touched the Shadows
Trap the Rogue Admin
Who Just Logged In From… Where?
Monitor for Unexpected Changes in System Binaries
🔖 Project: The Alert Engine

popup.text: Mastery here means reconstructing what happened during an intrusion—fast and accurately.

exercises.label: `grep`, `awk`, `cut`, `uniq`, `sort` on `auth.log`
Identify brute-force attempts via repeated IPs
Find sudo or su usage per user
Check login times and correlate to `bash_history`
Untangle a Timeline from Multiple Logs
Follow a Single Intruder’s Session
Trace a Silent Privilege Escalation
Spot Encoded Payloads in Bash History
🕹️ CTF: TryHackMe – Intro to Digital Forensics
Build a Timeline Tool in Python
Generate Incident Report in Markdown
🔖 Project: Timeline of Attack from Sample Logs
Bonus: Create Regex Patterns to Catch Obfuscated Behavior
Encode and Decode Messages with Base64
Build a ROT13 Encryptor/Decryptor
Detect Obfuscated Commands in a Log
Obfuscate and Deobfuscate a Python Script
Create a Self-Decoding Payload
Visualize Failed Logins from Sample Log
Plot Process Memory Usage Over Time
Geo-Plot Login Attempts by IP
Visualize User Activity by Hour
Animate Process Tree Growth Over Time
Identify Subdomains Using Public Tools
Google Dorks to Find Sensitive Files
Extract Metadata from Local Files
Find Public AWS Buckets
Automate Subdomain Discovery
Simulate a SYN Flood Attack (locally)
Perform ARP Spoofing in a Controlled Lab
MITM HTTP Traffic Using Ettercap
DNS Spoofing in a Virtual Lab

Capture Wi-Fi Handshake Using Aircrack-ng
Identify Local Wi-Fi Devices with Python
Analyze Wi-Fi Traffic Using Wireshark
Visualize Wi-Fi Signal Coverage at Home
Set Up a Basic SSH Honeypot (Cowrie)
Analyze Attacker Interactions in Honeypot Logs
Project: Custom Python Honeypot – Fake FTP Service
Find and Exploit a Basic API Authentication Flaw (JWT Manipulation)
Intercept and Replay API Calls with Postman and Burp
Enumerate Hidden API Endpoints with Burp Suite Intruder
Lab: PortSwigger – API Security Labs
Capture and Reuse Cookies for Session Hijacking
Forge Cookies to Escalate Privileges
Implement Secure Session Cookies in Flask
Build a Python Tool to Detect Weak Session Management
Exploit Vulnerable Client-Side JavaScript Validation
Bypass Client-Side Rate Limiting
Harden a Site Against Common Client-Side Bypasses
CTF: TryHackMe – JavaScript Exploitation Room
Upload a Simple Payload and Achieve Remote Execution
Evade File Upload Restrictions
🔖 Project: Harden a Flask App Against Upload Exploits
